question: [File: execution/executor-service/src/remote_executor_service.rs] [Struct: ExecutorService] [Round Manipulation] Can a malicious shard exploit the round-based cross-shard messaging to skip rounds or replay old round messages, violating execution ordering and causing state inconsistencies? (High)

[File: execution/executor-service/src/remote_executor_service.rs] [Struct: ExecutorService] [Shard Count Mismatch] If different shards are initialized with different num_shards values, can this cause message routing failures or incorrect shard assignment leading to transaction loss or duplication? (High)

[File: execution/executor-service/src/remote_executor_service.rs] [Struct: ExecutorService] [Command Injection] Can a compromised coordinator send malicious ExecuteBlockCommand messages that exploit deserialization vulnerabilities in the executor service causing remote code execution? (Critical)

[File: execution/executor-service/src/remote_executor_service.rs] [Struct: ExecutorService] [Result Tampering] Can an attacker intercept or modify execution results sent back to the coordinator via RemoteCoordinatorClient, causing the coordinator to commit incorrect state transitions? (Critical)

[File: execution/executor-service/src/remote_executor_service.rs] [Struct: ExecutorService] [Replay Attack] Can old execution commands from the coordinator be replayed to cause the shard to re-execute already processed blocks, leading to duplicate state changes or resource exhaustion? (High)

[File: execution/executor-service/src/remote_executor_service.rs] [Struct: ExecutorService] [Coordinator Impersonation] Does the executor service authenticate the coordinator, or can any network peer send commands by knowing the coordinator_address and message format? (Critical)

[File: execution/executor-service/src/remote_executor_service.rs] [Struct: ExecutorService] [Command Flooding] Can a malicious coordinator flood the executor service with excessive commands faster than they can be processed, causing channel overflow and message loss that halts execution? (High)

[File: execution/executor-service/src/remote_executor_service.rs] [Struct: ExecutorService] [State Cache Poisoning] Can an attacker exploit the RemoteStateViewClient to provide incorrect state data to the executor, causing transactions to execute with wrong initial state and produce invalid results? (Critical)

[File: execution/executor-service/src/remote_executor_service.rs] [Struct: ExecutorService] [State Staleness] Does the executor service verify that state data from RemoteStateViewClient is current and consistent, or can stale state be used causing non-deterministic execution across shards? (Critical)

[File: execution/executor-service/src/remote_executor_service.rs] [Struct: ExecutorService] [State Prefetching] Are state keys properly deduplicated and validated before prefetching, or can an attacker craft transactions with excessive or malicious state keys causing resource exhaustion or state corruption? (High)

[File: execution/executor-service/src/remote_executor_service.rs] [Struct: ExecutorService] [Cache Coherency] When multiple shards read and write overlapping state keys, does the executor service ensure cache coherency or can race conditions lead to inconsistent state views across shards? (Critical)

[File: execution/executor-service/src/remote_executor_service.rs] [Struct: ExecutorService] [TLS/Encryption] Does the NetworkController enforce encryption for all remote communications, or can attackers eavesdrop on transaction data and state information transmitted between shards and coordinator? (High)

[File: execution/executor-service/src/remote_executor_service.rs] [Struct: ExecutorService] [Authentication] Does the executor service authenticate remote peers (shards and coordinator), or can any network peer connect and participate in execution by knowing the correct addresses? (Critical)

[File: execution/executor-service/src/remote_executor_service.rs] [Struct: ExecutorService] [Message Size Limits] Are incoming messages from RemoteCoordinatorClient and RemoteCrossShardClient bounded in size, or can an attacker send extremely large messages causing memory exhaustion and crashes? (High)

[File: execution/executor-service/src/remote_executor_service.rs] [Struct: ExecutorService] [Connection Limits] Does the NetworkController limit the number of concurrent connections, or can an attacker exhaust file descriptors by opening excessive connections to the executor service? (Medium)

[File: execution/executor-service/src/remote_executor_service.rs] [Struct: ExecutorService] [Network Partition] If network partitions occur isolating some shards, does the executor service detect and handle this gracefully or continue attempting execution with incomplete shard participation? (High)

[File: execution/executor-service/src/remote_executor_service.rs] [Struct: ExecutorService] [BCS Deserialization] Can malformed BCS-encoded messages from the network exploit deserialization bugs causing panics, memory corruption, or arbitrary code execution in the executor service? (Critical)

[File: execution/executor-service/src/remote_executor_service.rs] [Struct: ExecutorService] [Type Confusion] Can an attacker send messages with mismatched type tags in BCS encoding causing type confusion during deserialization that leads to memory safety violations? (Critical)

[File: execution/executor-service/src/remote_executor_service.rs] [Struct: ExecutorService] [Integer Parsing] Are integer fields in remote messages (shard_id, round_id, etc.) properly validated for range and consistency, or can malicious values cause index out-of-bounds or arithmetic errors? (High)

[File: execution/executor-service/src/remote_executor_service.rs] [Struct: ExecutorService] [Nested Structures] Can deeply nested or recursive data structures in remote messages cause stack overflow during deserialization, crashing the executor service? (Medium)

[File: execution/executor-service/src/remote_executor_service.rs] [Struct: ExecutorService] [Gas Limits] Does the executor service enforce per-shard gas limits to prevent a malicious coordinator from assigning excessive work to specific shards causing resource exhaustion? (High)

[File: execution/executor-service/src/remote_executor_service.rs] [Struct: ExecutorService] [Memory Bounds] Are there memory limits enforced on the executor service to prevent unbounded growth from processing malicious blocks with excessive state access patterns? (High)

[File: execution/executor-service/src/remote_executor_service.rs] [Struct: ExecutorService] [CPU Throttling] Can an attacker craft transactions that maximize CPU usage in the executor service, causing performance degradation that affects consensus timing and validator participation? (Medium)

[File: execution/executor-service/src/remote_executor_service.rs] [Struct: ExecutorService] [Non-deterministic Execution] Can differences in executor initialization parameters (num_threads, timeout values) across validator nodes cause non-deterministic execution results breaking consensus? (Critical)

[File: execution/executor-service/src/remote_executor_service.rs] [Struct: ExecutorService] [Timing Dependencies] Does the executor service have any timing-dependent logic that could cause different results based on network latency or system load, violating deterministic execution requirements? (Critical)
